sentences.english: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.
sentences.chinese: 说，才德的女子很多，惟独你超过一切。

sentences.english: Everybody is down on me except you.
sentences.chinese: 大家都讨厌我，惟独你不。

sentences.english: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.
sentences.chinese: 惟独以色列人所住的歌珊地没有冰雹。

sentences.english: Now then, this is the only problem that does not figure in the pages of The Garden.
sentences.chinese: 可是《花园》手稿中惟独没有出现这个问题。

sentences.english: Only in the land of Goshen, where the people of Israel were, was there no hail.
sentences.chinese: 惟独以色列人所住的歌珊地没有冰雹。

sentences.english: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but the Lord made the heavens.
sentences.chinese: 外邦的神都属虚无，惟独耶和华创造诸天。

sentences.english: However, Jie declined his invitation, preferring to lead a hermit's life with his mother in the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 惟独介子椎拒绝接受封赏，他带了母亲隐居绵山。

sentences.english: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.
sentences.chinese: 惟独出口的，是从心里发出来的，这才污秽人。

sentences.english: You alone are my hearts' desire, and I long to worship Thee.
sentences.chinese: 惟独你是我心的渴望，我深愿来敬拜你。

sentences.english: It brings out the authentic flavor of every experience.
sentences.chinese: 惟独处能让人体会真实的多彩生活。

sentences.english: He alone does great marvels, his kindness endures forever.
sentences.chinese: 惟独他行了伟大的奇能，因为他的仁慈永远常存。

sentences.english: Only chinese wine and sour plum, makes me speechless.
sentences.chinese: 惟独是花雕加上话梅，令我无话可说。

sentences.english: Then Manasseh knew that the Lord is God.
sentences.chinese: 玛拿西这才知道惟独耶和华是神。

sentences.english: Everything has been figured out, except how to live.
sentences.chinese: 学富五车，却惟独不知如何生活。

sentences.english: But as for the Israelites who were living in the towns of Judah, Rehoboam still ruled over them.
sentences.chinese: 惟独住犹大城邑的以色列人，罗波安仍作他们的王。

sentences.english: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers' with thee.
sentences.chinese: 惟独归你一人，不可与外人同用。

definition: only/just (i.e. it is only that...)/all except/unique

(indicates that sth turns out just the opposite of what one would wish) unfortunately/as it happened/(indicates that sth is the opposite of what would be normal or reasonable) stubbornly/contrarily/against reason/(indicates that sb or a group is singled out) precisely/only/of all people
one thread, one hair (idiom); a tiny bit/an iota
cannot help/to be beyond control of
were it not for/if not for
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
to do something to sb/to deal with/to cope/how?/to no avail
